intro: Stephanopodium costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican stephanopodium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
